meanings.definition: To enter a place in large numbers, especially with harmful intent.
meanings.sent1: The ants invade the picnic area every summer, looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The enemy soldiers invade the peaceful village, causing chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels invade the bird feeder, stealing all the seeds for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The loud music invades my ears, making it hard to concentrate on my work.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds invade the sky, signaling an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: To encroach or intrude upon someone's privacy or personal space.
meanings.sent1: Please knock before you invade my room without permission.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi constantly invade the celebrity's privacy, trying to get a scoop.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat loves to invade my personal space, always wanting attention.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of loneliness can invade your thoughts when you are alone at night.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies can invade the entire house, making everyone hungry.
